verses.text:
Then there was a famine in the days of David three years , year after year ; and David enquired of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* answered , \add It is\add* for Saul , and for \add his\add* bloody house , because he slew the Gibeonites.  +  r 21.1  t enquired…: Heb. sought the face, etc *

And the king called the Gibeonites , and said unto them; (now the Gibeonites \add were\add* not of the children of Israel , but of the remnant of the Amorites ; and the children of Israel had sworn unto them: and Saul sought to slay them in his zeal to the children of Israel and Judah.)
Wherefore David said unto the Gibeonites , What shall I do for you? and wherewith shall I make the atonement , that ye may bless the inheritance of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*?

And the Gibeonites said unto him, We will have no silver nor gold of Saul , nor of his house ; neither for us shalt thou kill any man in Israel. And he said , What ye shall say , \add that\add* will I do for you.\f + \fr 21.4 \ft We will…: or, It is not silver nor gold that we have to do with Saul or his house, neither pertains it to us to kill, etc\f*

And they answered the king , The man that consumed us, and that devised against us \add that\add* we should be destroyed from remaining in any of the coasts of Israel ,\f + \fr 21.5 \ft devised…: or, cut us off\f*

Let seven men of his sons be delivered unto us, and we will hang them up unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* in Gibeah of Saul , \add whom\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* did choose. And the king said , I will give \add them\add*.  +  r 21.6  t whom…: or, chosen of the \+nd LORD\+nd* *

But the king spared Mephibosheth , the son of Jonathan the son of Saul , because of the \nd \+w LORD’s|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* oath that \add was\add* between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.

But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah , whom she bare unto Saul , Armoni and Mephibosheth ; and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul , whom she brought up for Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite :\f + \fr 21.8 \ft Michal: or, Michal’s sister\f*\f + \fr 21.8 \ft brought…: Heb. bear to Adriel\f*

And he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites , and they hanged them in the hill before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*: and they fell \add all\add* seven together , and were put to death in the days of harvest , in the first \add days\add*, in the beginning of barley harvest. \p

¶ And Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth , and spread it for her upon the rock , from the beginning of harvest until water dropped upon them out of heaven , and suffered neither the birds of the air to rest on them by day , nor the beasts of the field by night.
And it was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah , the concubine of Saul , had done. \p

¶ And David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from the men of Jabesh-gilead , which had stolen them from the street of Beth-shan , where the Philistines had hanged them, when the Philistines had slain Saul in Gilboa :
And he brought up from thence the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son ; and they gathered the bones of them that were hanged.

And the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son buried they in the country of Benjamin in Zelah , in the sepulchre of Kish his father : and they performed all that the king commanded. And after that God was intreated for the land. \p
¶ Moreover the Philistines had yet war again with Israel ; and David went down , and his servants with him, and fought against the Philistines : and David waxed faint.

And Ishbi-benob , which \add was\add* of the sons of the giant , the weight of whose spear \add weighed\add* three hundred \add shekels\add* of brass in weight , he being girded with a new \add sword\add*, thought to have slain David.\f + \fr 21.16 \ft the giant: or, Rapha\f*\f + \fr 21.16 \ft spear: Heb. the staff, or, the head\f*

But Abishai the son of Zeruiah succoured him, and smote the Philistine , and killed him. Then the men of David sware unto him, saying , Thou shalt go no more out with us to battle , that thou quench not the light of Israel.\f + \fr 21.17 \ft light: Heb. candle, or, lamp\f*

And it came to pass after this , that there was again a battle with the Philistines at Gob : then Sibbechai the Hushathite slew Saph , which \add was\add* of the sons of the giant.\f + \fr 21.18 \ft the giant: or, Rapha\f*\f + \fr 21.18 \ft Saph: or, Sippai\f*

And there was again a battle in Gob with the Philistines , where Elhanan the son of Jaare-oregim , a Beth-lehemite , slew \add the brother of\add* Goliath the Gittite , the staff of whose spear \add was\add* like a weaver’s beam.\f + \fr 21.19 \ft Jaare-oregim: or, Jair\f*

And there was yet a battle in Gath , where was a man of \add great\add* stature , that had on every hand six fingers , and on every foot six toes , four and twenty in number ; and he also was born to the giant.\f + \fr 21.20 \ft the giant: or, Rapha\f*
And when he defied Israel , Jonathan the son of Shimea the brother of David slew him.\f + \fr 21.21 \ft defied: or, reproached\f*\f + \fr 21.21 \ft Shimea: also called, Shammah\f*
These four were born to the giant in Gath , and fell by the hand of David , and by the hand of his servants.
